datafield.subfield: Artificial intelligence applications in distance education /
Utku Kose and Durmus Koc, editors.
Hershey, Pennsylvania (701 E. Chocolate Avenue, Hershey, Pa., 17033, USA) :

On the intersection of artificial intelligence and distance education / Utku Kose -- Global knowledge networking (GKN) with utilizing of digital libraries: a proposed model / Azadeh Heidari, Leila Nemati-Anaraki -- Intelligent educational support system / Duygu Mutlu-Bayraktar -- Designing a multi-agent system for improving the accounting e-learning / Bogdan Patrut -- Intelligent questioning system based on fuzzy logic / Omer Deperlioglu, Guray Sonugur, Kadir Suzme -- Review and proposal for intelligent distance education / Ali Hakan Isik, Göksel Aslan -- A web-based intelligent educational laboratory system for forecasting chaotic time series / Utku Kose, Ahmet Arslan -- Expert systems in distance education / Duygu Mutlu-Bayraktar, Esad Esgin -- For an intelligent e-learning: a managerial model suggestion for artificial intelligence supported e-learning content flow / Utku Kose -- Resolving the paradox of overconfident students with intelligent methods / Denis Smolin, Sergey Butakov -- Design and development of an expert system shell program and evaluation of its effectiveness / Aslihan Tufekci -- An example application of an artificial intelligence-supported blended learning education program in computer engineering / Tuncay Yigit, Arif Koyun, Asim Sinan Yuksel, Ibrahim Arda Cankaya, Utku Kose -- Agent-based distributed intelligent tutoring system using case-based reasoning / Shweta, Praveen Dhyani, O. P. Rishi -- Evaluation of clustering methods for adaptive learning systems / Wilhelmiina Hämäläinen, Ville Kumpulainen, Maxim Mozgovoy -- Evolutionary approach for automatic and dynamic modeling of students' learning styles / Fabiano Azevedo Dorça -- Ideas on the future of intelligent web-based e-learning / Utku Kose.
Access restricted to authorized users and institutions.

"This book seeks to examine the efforts made to bridge the gap between student and educator with computer applications through an in-depth discussion of applications employed to overcome the problems encountered during educational processes"--Provided by publisher.
Description based on title screen (IGI Global, viewed 09/19/2014).
